page.title: 05Rings Wood
page.content: The Iron Age Fort is now a round field.In the centre of the field is a patch of raised ground where the Iron Age people built their huts so that they were protected from their enemies.Everybody around had to help build it.THe fort looks rather like a bull fighting ring.There was a surrounding area which we think was a perimeter of the fort.The fort was built on highland for protection and so that they could see their enemies. There is a good view of the countryside.The perimeter hedge is now a circular grass mound.The diameter is approx. 95 metres.The map shows an additional enclosure connected to the perimeter hedge. We could see no signs of it but we think it was an animal enclosure.Also at Rings Wood we saw a ditch which we thought was an animal trap because it had some traps in it.
